Reviews.Title: Worked great out of the box
Reviews.Author: Adam Wright "Electrical Engineer"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!it worked great right out of the box once I downloaded and installed the appropriate packages (see below)I took pictures and videos, put the raspberry pi into time lapsed mode and they all worked seamlessly.Here is the website to get the camera up and running:[...]Here is the documentation to use this camera on the raspberry pi:[...]

Reviews.Title: RPi Camera Delivers
Reviews.Author: Joseph Cierniewski "jciern"
Reviews.Content: Pictures speak louder than words.See [...] to view my experience with this product.Another satisfied customer. I heartily recommend this item.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the Raspberry Pi
Reviews.Author: pianogod
Reviews.Content: I have been using webcams so far for the RP, but this camera uses the special port that the RP has for this camera, so it is a lot faster and higher resolution. It is no SLR lens cam, the lens is tiny, so don't expect wonders, but it seems to perform as well as a normal smartphone cam.

Reviews.Title: Gives my Raspberry PI a purpose
Reviews.Author: Dwayne Adams
Reviews.Content: Easy to setup and get going.Will record at 720P with a great picture for long as you want.1080P records with a great picture but I could only record at 1080P for about 20 seconds without making the Raspberry PI unresponsive.

Reviews.Title: There are Pluses and Minuses
Reviews.Author: P. McWhorter
Reviews.Content: There are pluses and minuses with this camera, and I will give my honest reaction after playing with it for some time.First, lets talk about the pluses. The camera is very easy to install and snap your first few pictures. Simply plug the ribbon cable into the Raspberry Pi board, and configure the camera using the standard Pi setup program. Then there are some very simple command line commands that you can give to snap stills or videos. So, in about 5 minutes you can have this up and running and taking your first pictures.I was impressed with the quality of the pictures. Definitely not what you would get from a sony handycam, but about on par with higher end camera phones.The reason for my three star rating is that it is very hard to incorporate this camera into  projects that go beyond simply clicking pictures from the command line. If you come from the arduino world where components come with libraries, tons of "instructables", online tutorials, and a vibrant user community always willing to help, you are going to feel very much alone trying to work with this camera. I did find a number of tutorials online where people had gotten it to work, but in most cases I could not replicate their success. For example, trying to build a camera that would remotely show realtime video on a windows machine, I could never get any of the examples to work in a stable fashion. The best I could do was a system that will work a few minutes and then lock up.In fairness, I am not a linux expert. If you are a linux expert, and can make linux systems sing and dance, then you will probably love this camera, and not have the troubles I have had. If you are an Arduino guy, like me, and trying to move up to learning a more powerful system, you likely will experience my frustrations.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: BobbyD
Reviews.Content: This is a really easy to use camera for the Pi.  There are a lot of instructions on the net for connecting it up and grabbing pics and videos.  Rasbian is all ready to use the camera with Raspivid for the video capture and Raspistill for pics.  There is a lot of confusing instructional information for conversion so you will need to do some research to go beyond just capturing a vid or pic.I would definitely recommend this device.

Reviews.Title: Module works great, despite the box
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera is an impressive little module that attaches to the Raspberry Pi.  Since there are only two available options for Pi cameras, I won't go into the fact that it works well because it was designed to work specifically with the Pi.  My gripe would be the box that the module comes in folds the ribbon cable in half which I originally feared had killed my module. I later discovered an error in the code I was using to operate the camera and the culprit, but a is seems that a better solution for packing the module needs to be identified.  Normally when the words ribbon cable and folding are seen in the same sentence it requires replacing the cable.

Reviews.Title: Works great.
Reviews.Author: Remus
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera, really is 5MP.  Difficult to get to using at first, but once you figure out how to make the pi find it, it works wonderfully.  I taped mine inside the plastic case that came with my pi facing out, it fits perfectly inside the case.  Plug it into the socket between the HDMI port and the Ethernet port, it fits in the other one, but it doesn't work there.

Reviews.Title: I can see, take pictures and video
Reviews.Author: james martel
Reviews.Content: This was a plug n play item. Thanks to books purchased I was able to download necessary "utilities" to make this functional.[...]this ap worked great and flawlessly with this unit

Reviews.Title: Not as good as hype
Reviews.Author: LinuxKing
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures - but expect about 25s to process each picture.  Just not enough HP for video of any kind - unless you are happy with video so bad you can't tell who's who or what's what.Still, a good toy to play with.

Reviews.Title: Wow! Stopped working after two days.
Reviews.Author: J. Hazel
Reviews.Content: Used for two days and all of a sudden camera is not detected. Googled and found out many others are having the same problem. Updated, upgraded, memory split, re-seated, and even tried on another pi to no avail.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: T.S. Ward
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price. Bought it for a raspberry pi security camera (made of Legos!) and it ended up working a lot better than I was expecting with motion. The specs as far as picture quality are as advertised.Be aware of the ribbon cable length, it seems to vary. The cable length isn't advertised and it seems to vary as I've seen reviews reporting 6" length. Mine was a little under 3" which was cutting it close for my project needs.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install buy with confidence.
Reviews.Author: Canaan
Reviews.Content: Easy to install easy to use, very great buy, much resolution, such sharpness. I would recommend to anyone who would like to tinker with a raspberry pi.

Reviews.Title: SO MUCH FUN!!!!
Reviews.Author: P. Pollock
Reviews.Content: I'm introducing my 7th and 8th graders to the world of electronics and building their own computers with Raspberry Pi.This camera works beautifully with the PI and actually gets some pretty great pictures.So much fun, so many possibilities. We built a teddy-bear spy camera where the Pi goes inside the bear's body and the camera replaces one of his eyes!

Reviews.Title: Works great, quality of video is better than expected
Reviews.Author: jb1t
Reviews.Content: I'm quite surprised with the quality of the video and pictures this little camera takes. I'd highly recommend the RPi camera module. There is also a NOIR (No Infrared filter) version that doesn't filter our the infrared spectrum, which looks really cool too, bc then you can do night vision with a IR LED

Reviews.Title: Didn't work!
Reviews.Author: Warren Krahenbil
Reviews.Content: The Raspberry Pi has been a good little machine but the camera arrived and just didn't work. I fought with it for a while but it kept throwing the same error. It was recognized by the Pi but no picture. A web search showed this error to be happening regularly to a number of people with no fix in sight. I returned it and will be thinking of a new solution for a camera in the house.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Rural Engineer CO
Reviews.Content: It's not just that this is a 5 Mega-Pixel (MP) camera... it's how this camera is integrated into the Raspberry Pi Architecture... very fast parrallel bus interface tied directly into the GPU. This camera supports all of the functionality you normally find on very high end security cameras.. like Region of interest, variable resolution and tons of additional options.  The Raspberry-PI + the PiCamera is eqivalent to a security camera that will cost you between $300 and $700. (In terms of functionality).  Those more expensive security cameras do have one advantage that the Pi solution does not have: Industrial grade weather proof enclosures (which is very important and worth the extra money).

Reviews.Title: Works awesome
Reviews.Author: IsaacFank
Reviews.Content: Just plugged it in and in minutes i was taking great pictures and video. Couldnt have been easier to set up.

Reviews.Title: Great accessory for the Raspberry Pi
Reviews.Author: Barry L.
Reviews.Content: It's absolutely amazing how tiny video cameras have gotten in recent years.  This one actually has higher resolution than full 1920 x 1080 Hi-Def, with over twice as many pixels.  It's fixed focus and the cable is pretty short, but for the cost, resolution and ease of use with the RPi, buying it was a no-brainer for me.  There are longer flat cables available for it, I think from Adafruit, but possibly from others as well.  I think a foot or so was the max on the longer flat cables, so if you need a greater distance than that, you'd probably want a USB webcam, but check the RPi compatibility website before buying one.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised.
Reviews.Author: ma77hew
Reviews.Content: Owned for several weeks now, works as expected! I would recommend for Raspberry Pi owners who want a dedicated camera over a USB webcam.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Andress Barajas
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time and is a must have for any Raspberry PI owner. Allows you to do more interesting things with the Raspberry Pi

Reviews.Title: twitchy, unreliable
Reviews.Author: brown dorothy w
Reviews.Content: if you like to mess with things that are cranky and inconsistent, buy this. i invested a lot of time and research to no avail trying to get this thing to work as security cam dvr.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I expected
Reviews.Author: T H Nolan
Reviews.Content: This worked exactly as advertised, arrived quickly and was well packaged. I hooked it up and used with no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Russ
Reviews.Content: Requires a bit of python programming and installation of some software.  It's all freely available and very easy to set-up.  There is a lot of documentation on the Internet showing how to use this camera with the Pi for a variety of applications.  Have fun!

Reviews.Title: Works well for inexpensive security
Reviews.Author: Jason Zurawski
Reviews.Content: Pair this with the camera mount, and place in a window facing outside.  Can find software in the raspbian universe to stream/process video live.  Have used to film a bird feeder and an out of the way entryway.

Reviews.Title: Great except the cable.
Reviews.Author: Cygnis Labs
Reviews.Content: Love it except the cable. Wish there was an option for a more robust cable that could be used outside of a case without the fear of damaging it. Also a non ribbon format cable would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the Pi
Reviews.Author: Doug K. Urban "DK"
Reviews.Content: The ribbon cable could be a bit longer but overall the kit is of good quality.  I built a little stand for mine from 1/8" plexiglass and 24AWG sheet metal.  The only thing that would make it better would be to have the programming code in with the documentation but that is easy enough to obtain.

Reviews.Title: Camera works quite well
Reviews.Author: justanothertechie
Reviews.Content: The module came quickly and installed easily (I followed a video tutorial). A software download was somewhat more effort simply due to lack of docs but the Raspberry Pi site had more than enough information and guides to get the basic camera functionality up and running. The only reason for a lack of 5 stars on this review is the expected difficulty in MOUNTING the module, something known beforehand yet still a negative. Otherwise this is a fine addition to the Pi computer.

Reviews.Title: pain in the butt to get working using motion program
Reviews.Author: Glen Ossman
Reviews.Content: took me 2 days of trying to get this to work , but the picture quality and stability are worth the effort.I can make out face at 200' none of my other cams are even close to the picture quality at distanceclose up they are the same but over distance this one is the best

Reviews.Title: Easy to get going
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: Used it to make a custom security camera. I'm not really a hardware guy, so I was pretty happy that this was easy to hook up to the Pi. No complaints, resolution of camera is perfect for my needs. I might get the IR version of this at some point.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality in good light
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The picture quality from this camera is amazing during the day. Both video and stills are better than than I expected in good light. The only downside is that it requires a lot of light. During dusk and dawn the images are grainy. At night it is entirely unusable.

Reviews.Title: Great little project
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Worked right out of the box. Easy installation. I thought it was a fun little learning experience setting it all up. If you are having any trouble setting it up, google is your friend. The instructions in the box are a little short but it really is just plug and play.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: My brother is already using it for his raspberry pi projects. Easy to use, and code with, i recommend it.

Reviews.Title: It good
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Duncan
Reviews.Content: It's pretty good, takes some tweaking to get to work with python code. it would be nice if it worked out of the box with python code, and didn't have to get code from another respository

Reviews.Title: All Good
Reviews.Author: Tom Howard
Reviews.Content: Camera works well and I was able to create a security camera that sends me email when motion is detected

Reviews.Title: A little expensive but integrates very well
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: So the Raspberry Pi Camera Module is a bit expensive but it integrates very well with the Pi and it means that I don't have to mess around with USB cameras. That time savings alone is worth the price. I wish the cable was a bit longer and that there was a housing of some kind included. A cheap case for the camera cost me another $5. But overall, the picture quality is great and there's built in support for capturing video and images. If only it was a bit cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Worked out of the box
Reviews.Author: James Scott Jr.
Reviews.Content: This a great high res camera for all sorts of uses.  I,m using it to sharpen my video processing skills.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Alfred
Reviews.Content: This was a present for my son (a Comp Sci major).  He built a cardboard box for it (hint: consider getting a plastic enclosure for the camera) and plugged it into the Raspberry PI I got him.  In a very short time, he had taken a still photo and emailed it to me all using the Pi.  Image was about 2.8Mb and had excellent detail, color balance, and sharpness.  I was frankly amazed at the quality and how fast he got it working!

Reviews.Title: Lasted just 1 day
Reviews.Author: Mohnish
Reviews.Content: The camera worked for a short time, after that the 'stuck at red light' bug that others have referred to. Returned it. camera is ultra sensitive to static, so be very careful.

Reviews.Title: I think is a very useful stuff
Reviews.Author: Juan Carlos Barron
Reviews.Content: Works very cool with a raspberry pi and is very easy to use and you could bring it a lot of use.

Reviews.Title: Great Addition to any Raspberry PI system
Reviews.Author: Edward J. Husar
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Raspberry PI 5MP Camera Board Module to create and build a mobile time-lapse system.  The camera works as promised and is a great addition to any Raspberry PI personal computer. Must have for any Raspberry PI owner.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: John Berrocal
Reviews.Content: So far I was able to use it based on the tutorials. I don't like the idea that I can damage with ESD. I'm planning to buy the case for this camera. Overall it works and it has a good resolution.

Reviews.Title: Pi Cam #FTW
Reviews.Author: Brian P. Bilbrey
Reviews.Content: works like a champ, video *is* better than still capture. But I need to type more words for a review. There!

Reviews.Title: Works well, video quality is decent
Reviews.Author: Nate
Reviews.Content: The quality is good for the price.  I mainly use it for motion detection and live video.  It is more of a project for me that I can tweak and play with.  I will probably still buy a professional security solution rather than rely on my RPi and camera for everything.

Reviews.Title: Static sensitive
Reviews.Author: C. Grant "fx4m"
Reviews.Content: Don't let your friend who thought "static electricity harming electronics was a myth" mess with it before it is connected to your Raspberry Pi. The second one worked great. It should not have been that sensitive, but I guess the desire for a really low price drove the design (of the board and the chips) to cut corners.

Reviews.Title: Delivered on time
Reviews.Author: NSTL
Reviews.Content: I got this little gem on time.  Unfortunately not a scrap of identification or instruction came with it.  Thank heavens for youtube!!!

ProductInfo.Features:
5 megapixel native resolution sensor-capable of 2592 x 1944 pixel static images
Supports 1080p30, 720p60 and 640x480p60/90 video
Camera is supported in the latest version of Raspbian, Raspberry Pi's preferred operating system
ProductInfo.Name: Raspberry PI 5MP Camera Board Module
